page.title: 04ON THE LAND
page.content: In Spring the farmers use tractors,drills,and crop sprayers to drill and spray the crops.They sow wheat,barley,oats,rape,potatoes,sugar beet and beans for food.Combines are used to harvest grain and crops in the summer.Farmers burn the combined straw after harvest.In the Autumn they plough the fields and sow barley for next year.In the Winter they cut the hedges.Cattle,sheep and pigs are also kept on the farm.The lambs are born in Spring and later put in the fields.In Summer the sheep are sheared to sell the wool.In Summer the cattle are in the grass fields,and in Winter they are fed hay and silage in the yards.One farm keeps cows for the milk.The lambs,cattle and pigs are sold for meat.Horses are kept for riding.Sometimes the farmers take their animals to Stamford market.
